column1: #text=I go grocery shopping every week to get food and any other items that my husband and I need for the week .
#text=I wait to go shopping usually until Thursday or Friday so that I can use the weekly ads to make my list .
#text=I shop for items on sale , so I like to be very prepared .
#text=I also use the store 's apps on my phone to track what deals they are offering for me this week .
#text=I plan out my list based on the ads and the apps , and write each store 's name above the items I want to buy there .
#text=On the day I decide to go , I drive to the first store which is whichever one I am getting less more cold things at .
#text=This way , they will stay colder together than if I buy one cold thing and it 's sitting by itself in the heat of the car while I shop at the next store .
#text=I park my car as close as I can to the entrance and grab a cart .
#text=I begin by opening my list and deciding which part of the store I am going to start in , and then work my way to the other end as I get the items that I need .
#text=I try to go quickly so it does n't take much time .
#text=When I 'm ready , I go to the front of the store and get into a line with a number that is lit up .
#text=If I have less than 10 or 15 items , I will sometimes go to the express lane .
#text=I wait for it to be my turn and unload the groceries onto the conveyor belt .
#text=After the cashier rings up my items , I will pay with either cash or my credit card .
#text=The items get bagged up and placed into my cart for me .
#text=I thank the cashier and take the cart to where my car is parked and put the groceries inside it .
#text=I then go to the next store and get any items I need there .
#text=I drive home and bring all the groceries inside my house , and then put them all away wherever they go .
